meanings.definition: To make (something) ineffective by applying an opposite force or effect.
meanings.sent1: The superhero neutralized the villain's powers with a special device.
meanings.sent2: The antivirus software neutralized the threat posed by the malicious program.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand neutralized the enemy's ability to cast spells.
meanings.sent4: The scientist neutralized the acidity of the solution by adding a base.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter neutralized the flames with a powerful extinguisher.

meanings.definition: To make (someone) unable to act in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: The tranquilizer dart neutralized the lion's ability to attack.
meanings.sent2: The hypnotist neutralized the volunteer's ability to resist suggestions.
meanings.sent3: The sleep-inducing potion neutralized the student's ability to stay awake in class.
meanings.sent4: The referee neutralized the player's ability to continue the game by showing a red card.
meanings.sent5: The allergy medication neutralized the sneezing and itching symptoms.

meanings.sent1: The scientist neutralized the acidic solution to achieve a pH of 7.
meanings.sent2: The gardener neutralized the soil to ensure optimal conditions for plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The chef neutralized the marinade to balance the flavors of the dish.
meanings.sent4: The pool maintenance crew neutralized the water to prevent corrosion of the equipment.
meanings.sent5: The pharmacist neutralized the medication to make it suitable for children.

meanings.definition: To make (something) harmless by counteracting its effects.
meanings.sent1: The antidote neutralized the venom of the snake bite.
meanings.sent2: The air freshener neutralized the unpleasant odors in the room.
meanings.sent3: The sunscreen neutralized the harmful effects of UV rays on the skin.
meanings.sent4: The neutralizing agent neutralized the toxic chemicals in the spill.
meanings.sent5: The neutralizing shampoo neutralized the chlorine in the swimmer's hair.
